p: Generally, a large variation in the chemical composition of the essential oil (EO) has been found in different juniper species due to: (1) within species and intra-population variability [ 16]; (2) different gender affiliation, as most junipers are dioecious [ 17]; (3) ecological characteristics of the habitats [ 18]; (4) different extraction methods [ 7, 19, 20]; (5) plant parts (leaves, galbuli, wood, or any mixes of those) [ 10, 21, 22, 23]; (6) time (season) of sampling [ 18, 19, 24, 25]; and, (7) the type and duration of the distillation [ 25, 26].
